error.signature: health check for container failed: unhealthy

verdict.summary: Docker container health check is returning non-zero exit codes consistently. The container is marked unhealthy, which can prevent dependent services from starting.

dead_ends.action: Removing the HEALTHCHECK instruction to avoid the error
dead_ends.why_fails: Hides the real problem; the service is genuinely unhealthy and orchestrators cannot detect failures

dead_ends.action: Setting very long health check intervals to delay detection
dead_ends.why_fails: Slow detection means unhealthy containers serve traffic longer, degrading user experience

workarounds.action: Debug the health check command inside the container
workarounds.how: docker exec <container> <healthcheck-command> to run the health check manually and see the actual error output

workarounds.action: Add a start-period to allow the application time to initialize
workarounds.condition: when the application has a slow startup

leads_to.condition: when dependent services fail to start because the dependency is unhealthy

preceded_by.condition: when resource limits cause the health check process to fail

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Both relate to health checks; docker-healthcheck-failing focuses on the health check command itself failing, while healthcheck-unhealthy is the resulting container state after repeated failures
